title: [Large-scale] Social-Organizational Collaborative Learning Strategies for Strengthening Foundational Business Administration Competencies: Citizen Capabilities and Institutional Improvement Focus

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of foundational business terminology, basic quantitative literacy and awareness of social organizational structures (hierarchy, networks, culture), elementary understanding of civic rights and responsibilities
context.additional_context: Operating a real-time feedback and group activity monitoring system using digital devices. Provides supplementary materials to enhance learners' civic consciousness (community participation, social responsibility) and adaptability to organizational culture (collaboration, diversity acceptance). Includes case studies and institutional improvement models for solving community issues.

learning_goals: Learners can apply core business concepts (e.g., organizational management, marketing strategies) to real corporate cases, explain them in socio-economic contexts, and perform analyses considering civil rights and institutional relationships.

Learners can establish and execute self-directed learning plans using digital tools (tablets, LMS) in blended learning environments, based on civic competencies (collaboration, responsibility, fairness).

In 4–5 member teams, learners can submit project deliverables (e.g., institutional improvement reports for community problem-solving) by drafting role allocation plans, holding ≥2 weekly team meetings, and meeting ≥2 of the 3 communication checklist criteria (clear communication, active listening, feedback provision) over a 4-week project period.
Learners can propose ≥3 creative ideas to solve problems presented in group discussions and develop action plans considering citizen participation and institutional improvements.

resources: Smart Pads and Basic Analysis Software
Circular table arrangement for collaborative learning
Emotion analysis AI program (for measuring group participation)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
